title: "What is the Difference Between a True Archetype and a Repressed Spiritualization in Quantum Psychology?"
first_phrase: In this final section, the author explains the concept of false archetypes and how they are a result of repressed spirituality. The author draws a distinction between true archetypes, which come from the void of undifferentiated consciousness, and false archetypes, which arise from a more solidified and defended place. The author notes that spiritualized people may appear spacious but are actually rigidified and defended. The author also explains the idea of universal psychological dissociative defenses, which become false archetypes. All of these concepts are explained within the framework of quantum psychology.
content: Those Archetypes which express repressed dissociative spirituality move from conscious or unconscious solidity to the illusion of spirituality, which is even more solidity. last_phrase: In conclusion, the journey towards spirituality can often result in rigidity and defensiveness, stemming from the creation of false archetypes formed as dissociative defenses.
